review_blob:
On tap at DC's Pub. Not a fan. The brown sugar and raisin sweetness is really up front in aroma and taste. Too much for my liking. But, does not linger and finishes somewhat clean. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bomber bottle to glass. This is a big beer! Dark amber, cloudy pour and creamy head. Big hops aroma. A big mouth feel and taste. Strong hops, but balanced by sweet and subtle citrus. If I had a complaint (which I don't), Hop Dam is maybe a touch sweet in the finish. The ABV is definitely there, but does not overpower. Mmmm...

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
beer_name: Hoppin Frog Hop Dam Triple IPA

review_blob:
On tap at Cobblestone. Pale and a little cloudy. On the sweeter side, but not over powering. Like a Saison? Very drinkable. The ABV just hangs out in the background. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Upland. Clear brown amber. A little bit of a nutty sweetness, but balanced. Medium to high carbonation. A good, easy drinking beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bomber bottle to glass. Cloudy amber pour. Very easy drinking. Balanced, mellow IPA. An ale, slightly nutty finish. Medium carbonation. The ABV is pretty subtle. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Upland Tasting Room. Surprise! I saw "harvest" and was thinking more of an October Fest-type beer. This is definitely a hoppy pale ale. Very hoppy aroma and flavor for you hops folks. A good beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Glass at Disney's California Adventure park. Cloudy orange-amber pour. Citrus and hoppy aroma. A balanced citrus and hoppy flavor. Finishes with a light bitter. Medium carbonation. Very good!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at The Library Alehouse, recommended by the bartender. Medium amber, cloudy pour. Very hoppy aroma. Taste starts off big hops (uh-oh--gonna be too bitter!), but then right away balances with citrus sweet. Medium/ high carbonation for a little more bite. Finishes with the same balanced hoppy-citrus. Overall, a little too big for me to so more than one, but a good beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at The Library Alehouse. A really good beer, recommended by the bartender. Clear, pale yellow pour. A light grassy, sweet aroma. Not overpowering at all. A nice balance of light flavors, more to the slightly sweet side. Medium to high carbonation. Finishes pretty clean. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle to glass. Deep amber color. A creamy head. Creamy mouth. Nice, balanced IPA. A little bitter lingers at the finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Growler to glass. Cloudy golden pour. Aroma has hint of banana. Some wheats are too sweet for my taste. This one comes on right away with banana, but stops short of being too sweet. The balance holds it in check. Medium carbonation. Finishes with that same sweet lingering a bit. A good beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Growler to glass. Aroma is all hops. I like the creamy feel, and then the hops kick in with some nice bitter. The alcohol hides out in the background, but that 9% is definitely there. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
beer_name: Sun King Cream Dream 007: Hops Are Forever

beer_brewer_name: Champaign County Brewing Company / JT Walkers Brewery
review_blob:
Growler to glass. A clear, medium amber. A little bit of a hoppy bite, with some sweet to balance it. Medium carbonation. Finishes with a lingering hops bite and an amber taste? Very drinkable, though! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
beer_name: JT Walkers Hale to the Chief

review_blob:
On tap at Cobblestone. An clear orange amber color. Sweet pumpkin spice aroma. A sharp pumpkin ale flavor. Relatively high carbonation. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
beer_name: Heavy Seas Uncharted Waters: The GreatER Pumpkin

beer_brewer_name: Champaign County Brewing Company / JT Walkers Brewery
review_blob:
Growler to glass. I don't generally like this style, but this is very drinkable. It pours a dark, clear amber. A generally sweet aroma. I definitely notice the caramel and roast flavors, but not overpowering. The scotch/ alcohol flavor is there, but also not overpowering. Medium carbonation. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle to glass. A cloudy amber-orange with a thick head. Very hoppy aroma with a little sweetness hiding in the background. Full mouth, medium carbonation. Hops, caramel, and grapefruit. Finishes with an alcohol tingle and hops bitter that lingers. Mmmm...

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. More of a breadiness with the hops bitter. I prefer an IPA that is balanced by citrus or pine. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can to glass. Beautiful deep, clear orange pour. A little off-white head and lacing. Hops and maybe a little bread in the aroma. Definitely hops leading the taste, but kept in check. A little sweetness, but the hops rules. Medium carbonation. A little bitterness at the end. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bomber bottle to glass. This DIPA has more of an edge to it. Finishes with a sharper bite, and lingers on the tongue with the hoppy bite and a little heat in the throat. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle to glass. To me, the key characteristic is a hint of melon (or a different fruit?) that hides just behind the aroma, and then again just behind the flavor. Although not overpowering, the fruit sweetness is not to my taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
beer_name: Sierra Nevada / Firestone Walker Beer Camp Torpedo Pilsner

review_blob:
On tap at Salty Cowboy. A sour citrus aroma. A lot of tart hops bitterness that stays up front. The bitter lingers a bit on the tongue. Good, but for my taste I prefer an IPA with the hops bitterness balanced by something else. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Part of beer camp. Bottle to glass. Really good. Citrusy aroma. Orange, golden clear pour. Pale ale flavor, balanced by subtle sweet citrus. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
beer_name: Sierra Nevada / Allagash Beer Camp Myrons Walk

review_blob:
Bottle to glass. Wow--that is a dark pour. A little bit of a creamy tan head that stays around and results in a lot of lacing. A roasted toffee aroma. Light to mild carbonation, quickly followed by the toffee sweet. The roast then comes and lingers on the tongue for a while. As the beer warms, the roast flavor backs down a little. This is a high ABV, but it stays behind the scenes in the taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
beer_name: Sierra Nevada / Bells Beer Camp Maillards Odyssey

review_blob:
Bottle to glass. Beautiful orange-brown pour. Nothing overpowering in the flavor, just a well-balanced and really good beer. Medium carbonation. A little malt lingers on the tongue--not very strong or caramely. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
beer_name: Sierra Nevada / New Glarus Beer Camp There And Back

review_blob:
Bottle to glass. A deep, clear caramel color with a thick off white head. Malt sweetness, with a little roasted hint in the aroma (with a little metallic?). Medium carbonation. A malty, yeasty sweetness. It mellows a little as it warms. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle to glass (purchased at New Glarus). A beautiful opaque, orange-golden pour. Strong pine and bitter citrus aroma. A big, full mouth flavor that is a little stronger bitter but balanced with citrus that lingers on the tongue. A lot of lacing. Mmmm...

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
beer_name: New Glarus Thumbprint Series Scream IIPA

review_blob:
On tap at Cobblestone Grill. A gorgeous creamy gold pour. Aroma is pretty neutral. Creamy in the mouth with low carbonation. Not very heavy hoppy bite, as it is muted by a light breadiness on the finish. As it warms, it finishes a little more sour. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Cobblestone Grill. Looks like a lot of carbonation in the pour. Then settles into a clear, medium amber. A light aroma that is subtly hoppy and sweet. Mmm--that's good. A bright, hoppy flavor that is balanced by some sweet undertones. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
beer_name: Three Floyds Space Station Middle Finger

review_blob:
Growler from the Sun King tasting room. A medium amber, clear pour with a one inch head. Hoppy aroma. A hoppy, carbonated bite with a little sweetness and tart citrus at the end. Finishes with hoppy bitter. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Brady's Brewhouse. A light yellow, very cloudy pour (looks like lemonade!). Not a lot jumps out in the aroma. Medium carbonation. A hint of lemon. Understated, but would be a really good beer to sip on throughout a warm day!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Brady's Brewhouse. A bright yellow pour. A light, bright taste that is heightened by a crisp carbonation. Very little after taste. Not a lot of dimension, but a good solid beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at outdoor event. Medium amber color. A little tinny in the aroma. A slight breadlines followed by a light bitter finish. A light to medium carbonation that has a foamy/creamy feel. A very nice, easy drink. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at DC's Pub. A clear golden pour. A slight musty, lemon fragrance. Light carbonation. Good balance. Finishes with a little tanginess on back of the tongue. Very drinkable on a hot day!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bomber bottle to glass. A very dark pour. Sweet caramel and raisin aroma. A lot of caramel and malt flavor, with light-medium carbonation. Finishes a little warm in the throat. Mmmm...

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Upland. A cloudy, dark orange pour. I like the spicy background the rye brings. A medium carbonation adds to the hoppy bite. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
beer_name: Upland Vinyl Tap Rye Pale Ale

review_blob:
On tap at Upland. A bright, clear golden color. A bright, light, fruity taste, but not overpowering. Medium carbonation. Very saison like. Very good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bomber bottle to glass. The aroma has a sweet breadiness. The taste bright sweetness leads (not overpowering, though), then switches to a honey and slight tartness. Light to medium carbonation. Very drinkable. Holds up even as it warms to room temperature.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Patrick's. A clear golden color. Crisp, medium carbonation. A clean, crisp taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Patrick's. Beautiful clear orange-golden color. This would be perfect for fall. Spicy nose. A creamy feel. The spice flavor dominates, but is not overpowering. Really good as a specialty beer, but not for my regular rotation. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhoneEarlier Rating: 10/6/2013 Total Score: 3.6A little sweet initially, followed by a slight bitterness, and then a wash of a fuller fruity sweetness. Very little after taste. Slight, fruit fragrance. Nice, medium carbonation. Like a sweet champagne. Nice! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
beer_name: Boulevard Smokestack Series - Tank 7 Farmhouse Ale

review_blob:
Bottle to glass. The fragrance has a faint sweetness, like wine, if you breathe in deep. Medium carbonation. A bit of a funkiness to the flavor, but it grows on you. That sweetness is hiding in the background at the end, almost like that from a saison. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at the Pine Room Tavern. A deep gold-orange pour. This is really good. A mild hoppy aroma. A very balanced beer, but a lot going on. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at the Pine Room Tavern. Clear yellow color. A mild sweet lager aroma. Mild carbonation. Wow--unexpected honey-sweet finish. The sweet finish calms down a little as it warms and pairs with food. Nice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle to glass at Bub's Burger. Cloudy, pale yellow pour. A sweet (honey/pear?), grassy smell. Medium carbonation. A subtle sweetness, but balanced. Easy drinking. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Cobblestone. A cloudy, dark golden poor. Piney aroma. Some sweetness coming through underneath, but the bitter leads. Sharp carbonation. A little lingering bitterness. Another very good 3F beer!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Tow Yard. Very good. A bright golden pour. A spicy aroma. The flavor is a balanced citrus/ hop that lingers a bit. Sharp carbonation. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Tow Yard. Medium orange-golden color. A strong, fruity aroma. Taste is more subtle, but the sweet (pear?) comes through. Very balanced flavor, with a slight alcohol burn at the finish. A light/medium carbonation. Really good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle to glass. Very good. A light, refreshing IPA. A cloudy yellow color. A very focused, but not overpowering flavor that is balanced in lemon bitter and banana (?) sweet. The flavor lingers with a light bitter on the tongue. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
beer_name: Sierra Nevada Snow Wit White IPA

review_blob:
On tap at Tow Yard. A deep golden color. A grainy aroma. A grainy, bready, spicy, crisp flavor. Mild carbonation. The grainy spice flavor lingers a little bit. This is a nice alternative to most beers I'm used to. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Upland. Cloudy, pale yellow color. An earthy, piney fragrance. A light piney, hoppy flavor and bitterness. Nice!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can to glass. Not a good style for me, so take that into consideration. A golden color. A sweet, deep in the nose fragrance. Medium carbonation, with a resonating sweetness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
